channel.title: Comments on: Windows Home Server 2011 & “the server appears to be offline” when trying to connect to the LaunchPad

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1222/comment-page-1#comment-4339">Sean</a>.
Unfortunately nope. It's some odd combination of hardware, drivers, and sun flares that cause it. :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sean.

Unfortunately nope. It’s some odd combination of hardware, drivers, and sun flares that cause it. :)

item.title: By: Sean
item.dc:creator: Sean
item.description: Thanks a lot! Solved my problem. Have you ever fiund out why this problem occurred?
item.content:encoded: Thanks a lot! Solved my problem. Have you ever fiund out why this problem occurred?

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1222/comment-page-1#comment-4051">DL</a>.
For some, there's a secondary solution apparently (see the blog post below)
http://newleaserelease.wordpress.com/2011/11/18/windows-home-server-2011-launchpad-offline-and-net-tcp-port-sharing-service-timeout/
item.content:encoded:
In reply to DL.

For some, there’s a secondary solution apparently (see the blog post below)

http://newleaserelease.wordpress.com/2011/11/18/windows-home-server-2011-launchpad-offline-and-net-tcp-port-sharing-service-timeout/

item.title: By: DL
item.dc:creator: DL
item.description: Posted previous comment... Your solution worked great...until I restarted the laptop. How do assure that these two services start every time I start the laptop? Thank you in advance. DL
item.content:encoded:
Posted previous comment…
Your solution worked great…until I restarted the laptop. How do assure that these two services start every time I start the laptop?
Thank you in advance.
DL

item.title: By: DL
item.dc:creator: DL
item.description: Fantastic! I was at wits end. Home server works perfectly now, thanks for posting this.
item.content:encoded: Fantastic! I was at wits end. Home server works perfectly now, thanks for posting this.

item.title: By: Jason
item.dc:creator: Jason
item.description: Thanks - I had the *exact* same problem, and your solution fixed it for me as well.
item.content:encoded: Thanks – I had the *exact* same problem, and your solution fixed it for me as well.
